intro: Brittonamra sericea, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage, which gives it its common name, and its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in arid and semi-arid environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
